ratings.comment: Professor Huang is a very intelligent man, but just not a good professor. When it comes to explaining math the lectures were very confusing and left me more confused than I was when I came in.

Huang is definitely not a good lecturer. He just reads the books but still has many mistakes in the lecture. I recommend reading the textbook instead of listening to his class. And also, Huang seldom look at the Piazza and didn't give the level of A in the beginning.

The most disorganized professor I've had. Poorly communicated exam times, content, and grading. Doesn't reply to email or piazza posts. Lectures are straight from the book, proof heavy, and he frequently messes up and has to erase his handwritten lecture. If you take 320 with him (I'd advise against it) just read the book don't watch lectures.

Lectures are copied from the textbook and way too proof heavy. The first midterm was coordinated and communicated exceptionally poor and the prof became confrontational with students on Piazza. Shaosai also refused to explain grading until after the final, so I could be getting an A or F and won't know until after the final is graded.

His recorded lectures are all hand-written, hard to read, and basically copy the textbook, so I stopped watching his recordings after midterm 1. I see classmates really care about their learning and give a lot of suggestions/ ask a lot of questions on Piazza but he hardly ever reply. Overall, I don't want to be mean, but he does not teach me a lot

Professor Huang was literally the worst professor/teacher I have had in my entire life. He puts no effort into his recorded lectures and frequently makes mistakes and has to go back so you will constantly be erasing your notes. He also grades the midterms questions super harshly compared to the TAs. Do not take this professor if you can avoid it!

He recently sent this email to us "Der all, todays lecture for MAT 320- will be uploaded later today. Best, Shaoasi". The improper capitalization and incomplete sentences, along with spelling errors (including spelling his own name wrong) show how little he cares about this class. "Later today" ended up meaning over 12 hours later than normal.

If you want a class where the textbook teaches you, take this professor. You can either have him read the textbook to you in his lectures, which are so disorganized you won't understand them, or you can just read the textbook yourself which I recommend because the textbook doesn't need to go back and erase mistakes every ten seconds.

He puts such little effort into his lecture and it makes them really difficult as a student. He mumbles and just basically copies from the textbook word for word. He also claims they will be uploaded by 11am on the specified date, yet sometimes they aren't posted until 9pm. Severe lack of passion and effort, how does this guy still have a job?

He posts recorded lectures yet he puts zero effort into his recordings. The videos often run over his allotted lecture time because he makes mistakes and doesn't bother to edit them out/restart. There is constant background noise which makes him difficult to understand. You are better off reading the textbook and teaching yourself.

This professor hasn't even bothered to organize his class whatsoever on canvas and has lectures that are so disorganized that others and I feel we aren't learning anything. While he seems friendly, the class structure is leading me to learn almost nothing by the third week, would not recommend.

Overall, this class was easy because I had taken it in high school, however the lectures were not helpful and very confusing. This then went into quizzes and exams only being given on Friday nights from 6-8 pm which was extremely frustrating. If you are looking for credits, do not take this class. It is more difficult than needed.

Seems like a nice guy but his lectures are kinda scattered. The notes are kinda messy. But fortunately there's no homework and the midterms and quizzed are from the worksheets and the book so take advantage of that.

Pretty nice guy but a poor instructor. Lectures were scattered and hard to follow. Sometimes wrote things down incorrectly on the board which made things more confusing. Doesn't explain concepts clearly and rushes through explanations too quickly. However, responds to emails quickly and goes out of his way to make office hours available.

Nice instructor, really cares about students. He is accesible outside of class and very patient. I still remember I was really confused about a type of problem and he spent a lot of time to make it clear. He also holds review sessions before exams. Finals are fairly easy comparing to midterms! (He runs his class overtime sometimes lol)
